question: What is Skyscraper Index (SI)?
option1: It is an index which exhibits the relationship b/w the living standards and happiness of the people residing in the multistory buildings of the worldâ€™s most developed cities
option2: It is an index of coefficients which measures the growth of a city by means of the overproduction of the labour, concrete, real estate and capital
option3: It is an index conceptualized and developed by UN Habitat which exhibits real time ratio b/w the population living in the skyscrapers and slums of a particular city, in a particular defined pattern
option4: t is a concept which explains that investment in skyscrapers peaks when cyclical growth is exhausted and the economy is ready for recession thus it is a predictor of Economic crisis, not boom
answer: t is a concept which explains that investment in skyscrapers peaks when cyclical growth is exhausted and the economy is ready for recession thus it is a predictor of Economic crisis, not boom
explanation: The Skyscraper Index is a whimsical concept put forward by Andrew Lawrence in 1999. He is a property analyst at Dresdner Kleinwort Wasserstein. This showed that the world's tallest buildings have risen on the eve of economic downturns.
